oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cheatham Place, n.d.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of the homes at Cheatham Place (Project Tenn. 5-11), not dated. Built as housing for white tenants during the Housing Divison of the Federal Public Works Agency's use of Nashville as an experimental field for public housing in the 1930s, Cheatham Place came under the control of the Nashville Housing Authority after it was incorporated in 1938. The housing project originally contained 314 units. Photographed by J.W. Smith of the Nashville Housing Authority. Forms part of the MDHA Photograph Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
